themes.label: Sacred Laws and Rules
themes.rationale: The text contains specific regulations regarding sacrifices, the distribution of sacrificial portions (perquisites), and the conduct of religious officials.

themes.label: Contracts and Private Legal Acts
themes.rationale: The mention of leasing (misthosis) suggests the administrative management of sacred property or revenues.

persons.name: Hieropoioi
persons.role: Sacred officials responsible for overseeing sacrifices

persons.name: Treasurers
persons.role: Financial officials involved in leasing or fines

rationale: This inscription is a sacred law from the island of Kos, dating to the late Hellenistic period. It regulates the cultic activities at the Aphrodision (Sanctuary of Aphrodite). The text specifies the 'gera' (honorary portions) such as the skin and leg of sacrificed animals that are to be given to the priestess and other officials like the hieropoioi. It also establishes a fine of fifty drachmas for those who sacrifice improperly and mentions the leasing of sacred revenues or lands under the supervision of the treasurers (tamiai). The mention of the month Panamos indicates the timing of these religious and administrative obligations.
